Description: Two fragments of large East Greek pottery plate, comprising six and two sherds respectrively and mended with plaster. Outcurving rim with two grooves top and bottom; very worn. Outside of rim and the slight area of underside preserved glazed, probably with added colour bands; guilloche band on top, with glaze on grooved areas, including at least one band of dots; ; incised inscription on rim.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1141)
